author: mheuer
content: Hey, I would like to ask in which order the different validator indexes that have been submitted to the BLSToExecutionChange pool will be processed.

author: mheuer
content:
I am asking because I would like to understand better when validators can expect their first withdrawals after submitting the credential change.
Is the following correct?

~533916 active validators
~58% have 0x00 credentials
~~7200~~ 115200 validators/day can change from 0x00 to 0x01 (16 validators every 12 seconds (per block))

author: mheuer

author: jgm
content:
> 7200 validators/day can change from 0x00 to 0x01 (16 validators every 12 seconds (per block))

That's out by a factor of 32, it's 16  * (86400/12) = 115,200

author: jgm
content: Ordering of change credentials operations on-chain isn't related to validator index.

author: mheuer
content: ah, forgot to multiply by 16 ðŸ‘Œ

author: jgm
content: Each block will contain operations based on what is in the pool of the beacon node proposing it, the order of arrival of those operations at the node, and the process used by the beacon node to select the operations from the pool.  Some beacon nodes were going to be last in first out, but I'm not sure which ones actually implemented that.  Others may be first in first out, or random, or... it isn't defined in the spec so up to the individual client teams to pick whatever method they wish.
